quotes.quote: You might be poor, your shoes might be broken, but your mind is a palace.
We are not rich by what we possess but by what we can do without.
Poverty is the worst form of violence.
An empty stomach is not a good political adviser.
Poverty won’t allow him to lift up his head dignity won’t allow him to bow it down.
It is not the man who has too little, but the man who craves more, that is poor.
Poverty wants much but avarice, everything.
One must be poor to know the luxury of giving.
In a country well governed, poverty is something to be ashamed of. In a country badly governed, wealth is something to be ashamed of.
Having been poor is no shame, but being ashamed of it, is.
Poor is the man who is not content with what he has.
Beggars can't be choosers.
Hunger drives the wolf out of the wood.
Hunger is the best sauce.
Let your head be more than a funnel to your stomach.
No clock is more regular than the belly.
Plenty sits still, hunger is a wanderer.
Poverty breeds discontent.
What good is honor when you are starving.
An imbalance between rich and poor is the oldest and most fatal ailment of all republics.
Laws grind the poor, and rich men rule the law.
Poverty is the parent of revolution and crime.
I believe that, as long as there is plenty, poverty is evil.
There’s no scandal like rags, nor any crime so shameful as poverty.
Money has been the most serious handicap that we have ever met. There are times when poverty is fortunate.
Where people are really attached, poverty itself is wealth.
We fought a war on poverty, and poverty won.
A decent provision for the poor is the true test of civilization.
You can’t get rid of poverty by giving people money.
Poverty is no disgrace to a man, but it is confoundedly inconvenient.
